radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral symmetric corneal changes, white limbal girdles of Vogt, frank thinning, irregular and edematous epithelium, diffuse stromal haze more pronounced in the left eye.
Confirmed advanced steepening of both corneas; keratometry readings were 52.75 D axis 088 and 36.87 D axis 178 in the right eye, and 57.37 D axis 008 and 54.75 D axis 098 in the left eye.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Bilateral steepening of the corneas observed.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Central corneal thickness of 335 µm in the right eye and 330 µm in the left eye.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: light microscopic examination of corneal button
radiographic_examinations.findings: Attenuated endothelium with prominent intracellular aggregates; thickened Descemet’s membrane with marked posterior nodularity; various-sized vacuoles present.
Thin epithelium with marked vacuolization and intracellular edema; thickened basement membrane, polymorphic vacuoles in the stroma.
